p: In a retrospective cohort study by Wong et al. on 64 patients with COVID-19 infection confirmed by rRT-PCR, CXR had a sensitivity of 69% compared to 91% for rRT-PCR and 97% for CT. The most common findings were bilateral peripheral consolidation with lower zone dominance, which showed its highest peak 10â€“12 days after symptom onset. Ground glass opacities were less common features. Interestingly, six patients in the study revealed chest x-ray abnormalities before confirming positivity on rRT-PCR. However, due to the low sensitivity of CXR compared to CT, further evidence is needed to support its use in the initial screening [ 78, 79].
